channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Dozens of heavy bells make Carillon high earthquake risk
item.description: The National War Memorial Carillon in central Wellington has been rated at just 15 percent of the earthquake code.

item.title: 'People are drowning in debt' - crackdown on loan sharks welcomed
item.description: Manukau Urban Māori Authority has welcomed the government's new regulations to crack down on predatory lending.

item.title: Geraldine farmers go to bat for endangered species
item.description: A colony of critically endangered long-tailed bats/pekapeka has been discovered at a property near Geraldine. The tiny bats used to be common throughout New Zealand in the 1800s.

item.title: Snow falling in parts of Central Otago, warning for Crown Range
item.description: It's a wintry start to the weekend, with snow falling in parts of Central Otago and a warning for the Crown Range and ice in the Queenstown Lakes area.

item.title: Birdlife, native bush set to benefit from biodiversity programme
item.description: Seventeen sites with regionally significant ecological values have been identified as new candidates for the Key Native Ecosystems programme in Taranaki, covering an area of more than 3000 hectares.

item.title: 'You sort of feel quite good': Displaced workers fell wilding pines
item.description: Hundreds of displaced Queenstown workers may be used to help tackle a growing pest problem - wilding pines.

item.title: Air NZ losing $5m a day, bracing for more job cuts - chief exec
item.description: Air New Zealand is losing $5 million a day and is bracing for potentially more job losses saying it needs to slash $150 million more from its wage bill.

item.title: Trans-Tasman travel 'crucial' for NZ tourism - Auckland Airport boss
item.description: Auckland Airport chief executive Adrian Littlewood wants a Trans-Tasman travel bubble on Cabinet's agenda when it meets on Monday.

item.title: 'Life comes first' - searcher who helped find trampers in Kahurangi
item.description: A single tea bag, a clothing label and a burned sock were vital clues that led to finding trampers Jessica O'Connor and Dion Reynolds alive and well.

item.title: Homicide inquiry opens after man dies at Hamilton property
item.description: A homicide investigation has been launched after a man died in Hamilton today.

item.title: Covid-19: A 'very good idea' to wear masks on flights - expert
item.description: Public health expert Nick Wilson is calling on the government to introduce masks on flights - and says its current advice is outdated.

item.title: Airbnb property owners switch to long-term rentals
item.description: Owners of Airbnb properties are switching to longer term renting, as tourism slumps following the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Airline refunds passenger as it ponders more job cuts
item.description: Air New Zealand has overturned a decision that forced one of its passengers to pay for new flights for her family - despite having a $2000 credit with the airline.

item.title: Deadly crash in Midhurst, Taranaki
item.description: One person is dead after a crash in Midhirst, Taranaki this evening.

item.title: Miniature horse Star's attacker jailed for 2.5 years
item.description: The man who viciously stabbed a miniature horse 41 times has been jailed for two-and-a-half years.

item.title: As it happened: Covid-19 updates from NZ and around the world
item.description: The Finance Minister says he is as keen as anyone else to move to level one next week. See how the rest of the day's Covid-19 developments unfolded with RNZ's live blog.

item.title: New Plymouth community wins battle against major subdivision
item.description: A controversial proposal for a new subdivision in the beach settlement of Ōākura in New Plymouth has been rejected.

item.title: EQC apologises again for delay in contacting homeowners over data leak
item.description: Sorry seems to be the hardest word, or so goes the Elton John song. Unless of course, you're the Earthquake Commission.
